template.name: TCC
CB

transition.label: i : t_id, j : seg_id, k : seg_id
lockedBy == -1
reqLock[id][i][j][k]?
result = lock(i,j,k), tid = i

query.formula: E<> forall(i:t_id) (Initializer.Initialized && not(TCC(i).Initial))
query.comment: All TCC are well-formed

query.formula: E<> forall(i:cB_id) (Initializer.Initialized && not(CB(i).Initial))
query.comment: All CB are well-formed
Split

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) not(CB(i).Switching) && CB(i).segments[0] != -1 && CB(i).segments[1] != -1 && CB(i).segments[2] != -1 && CB(i).connected != -1 && points[i] != -1 imply (Point(points[i]).Plus && CB(i).connected == cBs[i][1]) || (Point(points[i]).Minus && CB(i).connected == cBs[i][2])
query.comment: The local state information about connected segments of a switch box is consistent with the actual state of the switch.
A train can only cross a point if the point's position is consistent with the segment that the trains is entering.
No derailment.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).DoubleSegment imply points[TCC(i).nextCB] == -1 || Point(points[TCC(i).nextCB]).Plus || Point(points[TCC(i).nextCB]).Minus)
query.comment: No derailment. A train can only be in a double segment position at a point that is not in the middle of switching.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).resSegIndex - TCC(i).nextSegIndex) <= resLimit
query.comment: A TCC will never reserve more than what is specified

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) not(TCC(i).Initial) imply (TCC(i).resSegIndex - TCC(i).prevResIndex) == 1
query.comment: The resSegIndex will always be one higher than the previous index

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).lockIndex - TCC(i).origLockIndex) > 0
A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:cB_id) exists(k:int[1,2]) CB(j).lockedBy == i imply CB(j).res[0] == i and CB(j).res[k] == i
query.comment: For every lock that a TCC has obtained at a switch box, it has the reservation for the stem segment at the switch box and one of the segments that the switch box can connect the stem to

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) exists(j:int[0,2]) exists(k:int[0,2]) TCC(i).Locking and j != k imply (TCC(i).segments[TCC(i).lockIndex] == CB(TCC(i).boxes[TCC(i).lockIndex]).segments[j] and TCC(i).segments[TCC(i).lockIndex - 1] == CB(TCC(i).boxes[TCC(i).lockIndex]).segments[k])
query.comment: A TCC will only lock control box with two adjacent segments

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) CB(i).Switched imply CB(i).result == CB(i).DOSWITCH or CB(i).result == CB(i).NOSWITCH
query.comment: CB will only send and OK to a TCC if it is in the Switched location and the result is either DOSWITCH or NOSWITCH

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) CB(i).Passing imply CB(i).LockAttempted + CB(i).Switching + CB(i).Switched == 0
query.comment: A CB cannot be lock and switch a point when a train is in its critical section (Correct by construction)

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) CB(i).Switched imply CB(i).lockedBy == -1
query.comment: A control box only returns an acknowledgement for a lock request if its point was unlocked prior to the request

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) (TCC(i).DoubleSegment and points[TCC(i).nextCB] != -1) imply CB(TCC(i).nextCB).lockedBy == i
query.comment: A train only passes a switch box if it has been locked for the train

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) TCC(i).DoubleSegment and TCC(i).nextSegIndex == TCC(i).routeLength imply !(CB(TCC(i).boxesLength - 1).Passing) and CB(TCC(i).boxesLength - 1).lockedBy != i

A[] forall(i:t_id) TCC(i).DoubleSegment imply CB(TCC(i).nextCB).countTCCReservations(i) == 2 and CB(TCC(i).boxes[TCC(i).nextSegIndex+1]).countTCCReservations(i) <= 2 and CB(TCC(i).boxes[TCC(i).nextSegIndex+1]).countTCCReservations(i) >= 1
query.comment: A train only enters a segment that is has the full reservation of.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) TCC(i).DoubleSegment imply points[TCC(i).nextCB] == -1 or Point(points[TCC(i).nextCB]).SwitchingPM + Point(points[TCC(i).nextCB]).SwitchingMP == 0
query.comment: No derailment alternative

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:int[0,1]) TCC(i).DoubleSegment imply (TCC(i).segments[TCC(i).nextSegIndex-j] == CB(TCC(i).nextCB).segments[0] or TCC(i).segments[TCC(i).nextSegIndex-j] == CB(TCC(i).nextCB).connected)
query.comment: If a train is in a critical point section, then the segments that it is moving on are connected

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) exists(j:int[0,2]) CB(i).res[j] != -1 imply TCC(CB(i).res[j]).cbInBoxes(i) <= TCC(CB(i).res[j]).resSegIndex
query.comment: The reservation data of a control box is consistent with the reservation data of TCCs.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:cB_id) CB(i).lockedBy != -1 imply TCC(CB(i).lockedBy).cbInBoxes(i) <= TCC(CB(i).lockedBy).lockIndex
A[] forall(i:cB_id) CB(i).ReserveAttempted imply CB(i).valid
A[] forall(i:cB_id) CB(i).ReserveAttempted and CB(i).result >= 0 imply CB(i).res[CB(i).result] == -1
query.comment: A control box only returns an acknowledgement for reservations involving segments that are not already reserved

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:cB_id) TCC(i).cbInBoxes(j) == -1 imply not(CB(j).LockAttempted and CB(j).tid == i)
query.comment: A TCC only obtains locks at switch boxes on its route

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:cB_id) exists(k:int[0,2]) TCC(i).Reserving + CB(j).ReserveAttempted == 2 and CB(j).tid == i imply TCC(i).segments[TCC(i).resSegIndex] == CB(j).segments[k]
query.comment: A TCC only reserves segments on its route

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:cB_id) TCC(i).Reserving + CB(j).ReserveAttempted == 2 and CB(j).tid == i imply TCC(i).cbInBoxes(j) >= 0
query.comment: A TCC only reserves segments at control boxes on its route

query.formula: A[] not deadlock
E<> forall(i:t_id) TCC(i).Arrived
query.comment: All trains will eventually arrive at their destinations.

query.formula: A[] forall(i:t_id) forall(j:t_id) i != j and not(TCC(i).Initial) and not(TCC(j).Initial) imply TCC(i).curSeg != TCC(j).curSeg
query.comment: Two trains are never on the same segment after the initialization step.

query.formula: A[] forall(id:t_id) forall(i:cB_id) TCC(id).Initial or (TCC(id).boxes[i] == boxRoutes[id][i] and not(TCC(id).Initial))
query.comment: A trains internal notion of the control boxes will always be the same as its global counterpart after it has left the initial state

query.formula: A[] forall(id:t_id) forall(i:seg_id) TCC(id).Initial or (TCC(id).segments[i] == segRoutes[id][i] and not(TCC(id).Initial))
query.comment: A trains internal notion of its route will always be the same as its global counterpart after it has left the initial state
